samples.context: It was a tough morning commute around the city. If it is rush hour, the traffic gets bad on the roads. If the traffic is bad, many people end up late for work. The trains also tend to have issues during rush hour. If the train is delayed, the passengers get frustrated. This morning, either it was rush hour, or the train was delayed, or both things occurred.
samples.question: If many people were not late for work, were the train passengers frustrated?

samples.context: Sara had a midterm exam in her hardest class today. If Sara studied many hours, she felt very prepared for the exam. If Sara felt prepared, she was likely to get an A. However, if the professor postponed the exam, then Sara would take it next week instead. Today, either Sara studied many hours, or the exam was postponed, or both happened.
samples.question: If Sara did not get an A on the exam, did she take it next week?

samples.context: It was a bad day for baking. If the ingredients are mixed improperly, the cake won't rise right while baking. If the cake doesn't rise properly, the cake tasting will be a disaster. Also if the oven is not working right, the cake will be undercooked. Today, either the ingredients were mixed improperly, or there was an issue with the oven, or both things occurred.
samples.question: If the cake tasting was not a disaster, was the cake undercooked?

samples.context: Last night we experienced some unusual weather. If the electricity goes out, the room becomes dark. If the room is dark, we light candles to see. If it starts raining, the streets get wet from the rain. Last night, either the electricity went out, it started raining, or both things happened.
samples.question: If we did not light any candles, did the streets get wet?

samples.context: Mary takes the bus to work each morning. If the bus is late, then Mary is late for work. If Mary is late for work, her boss gets upset. On the same route, if there is traffic on the highway, commuters get frustrated. This morning, either the bus was late, or there was highway traffic, or both occurred.
samples.question: If Mary's boss was not upset, were commuters frustrated?

samples.context: On a blustery day like today, strong winds can cause problems. If it is windy, tree branches can snap from the force. If branches snap, leaves end up scattered on the ground. Sam loves flying his kite, and windy days are perfect for it. If Sam flew his kite today, it went high in the sky. Either it was windy today, Sam flew his kite, or both things occurred.
samples.question: If there were no leaves scattered, did Sam's kite go high?

samples.context: The town was recovering from a major storm system that brought severe weather. If a tornado hit town, many buildings would become damaged. If buildings were damaged, debris would be everywhere. If a hurricane flooded the streets, cars would end up submerged. This storm system brought either a tornado, or flooding from a hurricane, or both.
samples.question: If there was no debris from damaged buildings, were cars submerged from flooding?

samples.context: ABC Company relies heavily on its sales performance. If the company has strong sales, then its revenue increases. If revenue increases, the company hires more employees. The company also recently opened a new factory. If the factory adds a new assembly line, then production increases there. This quarter, either sales were strong, or a new assembly line was added, or both things happened.
samples.question: If ABC Company did not hire more employees, did production increase at the factory?

samples.context: The farm was at the mercy of the weather this growing season. If the crops get enough sunlight, they will grow to maturity. With mature crops, there can be a successful harvest. However, if a drought hits, the crops will dry up while still in the fields. This year, either the crops got enough sunlight, or there was a drought, or both things happened.
samples.question: If the harvest was not successful, does that mean a drought destroyed the crops?

samples.context: It was a hectic morning in the Jones household. If the stove is left on, the pot boils over and makes a mess. If the pot boils over, there is a big mess to clean up. Also, if the dog gets into the trash, the floor ends up covered in garbage. Today, either the stove was left on, or the dog got into the trash, or both things happened.
samples.question: If there is no mess to clean up, is the floor covered in garbage?

samples.context: It was a tough week leading up to the product launch. If a deadline is unrealistic, employees have to cut corners to try meeting it. If corners are cut, the final product suffers. Also, if key staff are out sick, the timeline tends to slip. This past week, either the deadline was unrealistic, key people were out sick, or both things occurred.
samples.question: If the final product was not sloppy, did the project timeline slip?

samples.context: The local government had options for implementing policy changes. If the city council approved a proposal, an existing statute gets changed. If a statute is changed, then any new rules go into effect. Additionally, if voters reject a referendum, then no policy changes are made. This month, the city council either approved a proposal, or a referendum was rejected, or both occurred.
samples.question: If no new rules went into effect, does that no policy changes are made?

samples.context: It was an eventful concert last night. If the venue oversells tickets, it can dangerously exceed capacity. If the venue is over capacity, the fire marshal may get called to shut it down. Also, if a fight breaks out, the show will get cancelled for safety reasons. Last night, either the venue oversold tickets, there was a fight, or both things happened.
samples.question: If the fire marshal was not called, was the show cancelled?

samples.context: The software team had an important deadline coming up. If the deadline is approaching, the team ends up working overtime. If the team works overtime, they will complete the project on time. However, if the server crashes, they lose work and data. Either the deadline was approaching, or the server crashed, or both things occurred.
samples.question: If the project was not completed on time, did they lose work and data?

samples.context: It was an eventful Saturday in town. If it is the weekend, the mall gets very crowded as people have free time to shop. If the mall is crowded, there tend to be long lines at the registers. Also, yesterday was payday at many jobs. If it's payday, people have some extra money to spend. Today, either it was the weekend, or it was payday yesterday, or both things occurred.
samples.question: If there were no long lines, did people have money to spend?
